metadata.title: CVE-2017-12791 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in minion id validation in SaltStack Saltbefore 2016.11.7 and 2017.7.x before 2017.7.1 allows remote minions withincorrect credentials to authenticate to a master via a crafted minion ID.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12791` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

salt-api - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
salt-cloud - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
salt-common - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
salt-master - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
salt-minion - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
salt-proxy - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
salt-ssh - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
salt-syndic - 2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: salt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2015.8.8+ds-1ubuntu0.1+esm1').
